articles.headline: Obama Campaign Fears Uphill Climb Raising ‘Super PAC’ Money
articles.snippet: Democrats are warning supporters that a huge cash advantage mustered by Republican groups could overwhelm President Obama in the fall.
articles.abstract: Democrats are warning supporters that a huge cash advantage mustered by Republican groups could overwhelm President Obama in the fall.
articles.lead_paragraph: The warning came from David Plouffe, President Obama’s top political adviser: The Koch brothers and Republican “super PACs” have pledged hundreds of millions of dollars to defeat Mr. Obama, he told a dozen wealthy Democrats gathered in a Silicon Valley office suite. Do not believe what you read about all the money the president will raise himself, Mr. Plouffe urged them. He needs your help.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore and Michael Luo

articles.headline: Nasdaq Finishes Above 3,000, Its Best Since Dot-Com Bubble
articles.snippet: Stocks climbed to new heights in part on rosy retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008 and the Nasdaq composite index past the 3,000 milestone for the first time since 2000.
articles.abstract: Stocks climbed to new heights in part on rosy retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008 and the Nasdaq composite index past the 3,000 milestone for the first time since 2000.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks rose to new heights on Tuesday, in part on stronger retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008 and the Nasdaq composite index to close above 3,000 for the first time since 2000.

articles.headline: 15 of 19 Big Banks Pass Fed’s Latest Stress Test
articles.snippet: The central bank said 15 of 19 could weather a sharp downturn, but the industry’s recovery is uneven.
articles.abstract: The central bank said 15 of 19 could weather a sharp downturn, but the industry’s recovery is uneven.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve had a key take-away from the latest round of stress tests: most big banks are in good shape.
articles.byline: By PETER EAVIS and J. B. SILVER-GREENBERG

articles.headline: Obama Files a Complaint Over China
articles.snippet: President Obama said the United States was taking the first step toward filing a legal case against the Chinese government over its reported hoarding of rare earth metals.
articles.abstract: President Obama said the United States was taking the first step toward filing a legal case against the Chinese government over its reported hoarding of rare earth metals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If there was ever any doubt about the political salience of China in an election year, it was erased Tuesday, when President Obama stepped before cameras in the White House Rose Garden to announce a procedural move in a long-running trade dispute with China over rare earth metals.

articles.headline: Santorum Takes 2 Races in South; Romney Is Third
articles.snippet: Rick Santorum captured twin victories in Alabama and Mississippi on Tuesday, amplifying his argument that the nominating fight is becoming a two-man race, while Mitt Romney won Hawaii’s caucuses early on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: Rick Santorum captured twin victories in Alabama and Mississippi on Tuesday, amplifying his argument that the nominating fight is becoming a two-man race, while Mitt Romney won Hawaii’s caucuses early on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. — Rick Santorum captured twin victories in the Alabama and Mississippi primaries on Tuesday, overcoming the financial advantages of Mitt Romney and the Southern allegiances to Newt Gingrich on a night that amplified his argument that the Republican nominating fight is becoming a two-man race with Mr. Romney.

articles.headline: Inmate’s Lament: ‘Rather Be Dead Than Here’
articles.snippet: A Honduran fire and a Mexican massacre have drawn new attention to dangerous conditions in Latin American prisons, which have outlasted scrutiny before.
articles.abstract: A Honduran fire and a Mexican massacre have drawn new attention to dangerous conditions in Latin American prisons, which have outlasted scrutiny before.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR — In a prison called Hope, there is little of it to go around.

articles.headline: A Nation With Too Many Tax Breaks
articles.snippet: At first glance, the federal budget seems tilted to take from the rich and redistribute to the rest, but there is an alternate way to measure how the government moves resources across the economy.
articles.abstract: At first glance, the federal budget seems tilted to take from the rich and redistribute to the rest, but there is an alternate way to measure how the government moves resources across the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the presidential election in sight and a deadline looming at the end of the year to cut trillions from the deficit, the partisan debate over the budget has become an existential battle over the purpose of government.

articles.headline: Public Exit From Goldman Raises Doubt Over a New Ethic
articles.snippet: Greg Smith’s resignation is bringing new attention to Wall Street’s culture, which he decried in an open diatribe.
articles.abstract: Greg Smith’s resignation is bringing new attention to Wall Street’s culture, which he decried in an open diatribe.
articles.lead_paragraph: Behind closed doors, it is a conversation that has been taking place with increasing urgency on Wall Street in recent years: making money is good, but is making more money always better, even if it comes at the expense of clients?
